result.execSummary:
The defendant Javonta D Henry was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Injury by Negligent Handling of Dangerous Weapon, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.24(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Huber for work and school.
*Court denies defendant's request for expungement.

charges.descr: Injury by Negligent Handling of Dangerous Weapon

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Javonta D Henry in court with attorney Alejandro A Lockwood.  Defendant Javonta D Henry in custody.  Randy P Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

  The Court ordered the Defendant to:
-Serve 6 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 47 days time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for work and school.
-Defendant is to pay court costs and victim/witness surcharges by 7/1/2016; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay related surcharge by 7/1/2016; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Restitution set at zero
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
**Court denies the defendant's request for expungement

Attorney Alejandro A Lockwood in court, defendant Javonta D Henry not in court, in custody. Karen Behling for Randy P Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Court is not in session. Case rescheduled for SENTENCING on 7/1/2014 at 1:30 pm in Branch 15.
Defense Sentencing Memorandum received and filed. sab

Defendant Javonta D Henry in court with attorney Alejandro A Lockwood.  Defendant Javonta D Henry in custody.  Randy P Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored. Case calendared for SENTENCING on 6/20/2014 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.

Attorney Alejandro A Lockwood in court.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    
Cas is adjourned for Plea Hearing, Branch 15.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 25, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Javonta D Henry in court with attorney Alejandro A Lockwood.  Defendant Javonta D Henry in custody.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15.    Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 15.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 27, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with ALBERT G.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Javonta D Henry in court with attorney Dawn Rablin.  Defendant Javonta D Henry in custody.  Paul L Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge WATTS, Branch 15.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 17, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
